Floor: #128
Post Time: 29th January 2014, 05:48 PM
Poster ID: Fuzzynuts
Post Title: None
Post Content: 
Ok I don't speak the lingo, but recall nee how or ni hau or ni ha or however you spell it was the same for both Cantonese and Mandarin. Everywhere I've been both north, south and HK it's some derivative of this phrase. Canton (ie where they speak Cantonese - now Guangzhou) is on the mainland so there's no guarantees on what you're getting, unless you get a Jap or Korean in which case you end up like the guy above and get it wrong anyway

1. If you turn up without a booking you will have to ask Wilson who is available. you may be turned away if all the WLs are busy or he will let you know who is available or when the next availability is and who its with. There is usually not much choice. you can meet the lady and if she's not to your liking you can leave. I've never experienced a line up and I've never turned a lady back.
2. BBBJ is pretty well standard here and CIM is usually an extra $20.
3. the higher costs usually vary depending on the age, looks, experience and extra services. It doesn't always reflect the service. I have never had a bad top shelf WL. I have had some ordinary and some extraordinary Silver WLs.
4. most know some basic English. many speak good English. I don't speak any Asian languages at all and I've never had a problem
hope this helps
